intro: Saxofridericia, commonly known as the desert rose, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements.
